SEARCH
Package proxy

Class Console

java.lang.Object
proxy.Console
All Implemented Interfaces:
Errors
public class Console extends Object implements Errors
The Console is the main component in the program, it accepts commands from the user.

  • Constructor Details

    • Console

      Default c-tor.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the console interface for the Proxy application and listens for user input until the application is exited. The method reads input from the standard input stream and parses it to execute the corresponding command. The supported commands are block URL, unblock URL, print blocked URLs list, download file from URL, and exit. The method executes the corresponding command object based on the user input and handles any exceptions that may occur.

    • checkUBArguments

      private void checkUBArguments(String[] tokens) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks the given array of tokens to ensure that it has at least the minimum number of arguments required for block URL or unblock URL command, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it doesn't.
      Parameters:
      tokens - the array of tokens to check for the required number of arguments
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the array does not have the required number of arguments

    • executeCommand

      private void executeCommand(Command command)
      Executes the given command by calling its execute() method.
      Parameters:
      command - the Command object to execute

    • exit

      private void exit()
      Exits the application by calling System.exit() with the SUCCESS status code.

    • executeDownload

      private void executeDownload(String[] tokens) throws IOException
      Executes the download from URL command with the given tokens by creating a DownloadFromURL object with the given URL, flags, and output file name, and executing it. If the URL is invalid, throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      tokens - the array of tokens containing the URL, flags, and output file name for the download command
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the URL is invalid
      IOException - if there is an error reading or writing the file

    • isValidUrl

      public static boolean isValidUrl(String urlString)
      Checks whether the given URL string is a valid URL.
      Parameters:
      urlString - the string to check for validity as a URL
      Returns:
      true if the string is a valid URL, false otherwise
